conditions.name: Safety Review for Dose Titration
conditions.description: Safety Review Committee (SRC) must review available safety data through Day 23 for each participant before titration to 30 mg/day.
conditions.text: Before titration to 30 mg/day, the Safety Review Committee (SRC) will review available safety data through Day 23 for each participant.

conditions.name: Outpatient Period Extension
conditions.description: The Outpatient Period during Treatment Period 1 may be extended up to an additional 14 days with Investigator approval.
conditions.text: To ensure flexibility, the Outpatient Period during Treatment Period 1 may be extended up to an additional 14 days with Investigator approval.

conditions.name: ALT/AST Elevation (Moderate)
conditions.description: Criteria for temporary dose interruption due to liver enzyme elevation.

conditions.name: ALT/AST Elevation (Severe)
conditions.description: Criteria for permanent dose discontinuation due to liver enzyme elevation.

conditions.name: Neutropenia
conditions.description: Criteria for dose reduction due to low neutrophil count.
conditions.text: Neutrophils > 30% decrease from baseline and below reference range at baseline

conditions.name: Potential Liver Injury (Hy's Law)
conditions.description: Criteria for temporary dose interruption due to concurrent bilirubin and ALT elevation.
conditions.text: Bilirubin > 2 × ULN accompanied by ALT > 3 × ULN

conditions.name: Neurologic Worsening
conditions.description: Clinical evidence of neurologic worsening triggers a review for dose modification.
conditions.text: Evidence of neurologic worsening by AEs or by neurologic physical exam assessment

conditions.name: Psychiatric Worsening
conditions.description: Clinically significant acute psychiatric worsening triggers a review for dose modification.
conditions.text: Evidence of clinically significant acute psychiatric worsening which may include but not limited to suicidality, acute depression, or psychosis.

conditions.name: Rechallenge Limit
conditions.description: A maximum of 3 rechallenges will be allowed after dose interruption.
conditions.text: A maximum of 3 rechallenges will be allowed.

transitionRules.name: Dose Titration to 30mg
transitionRules.text: Following the Run-in Period, participants will be administered ALXN1840 at 15 mg/day for a treatment period of approximately 28 days followed by titration up to 30 mg/day on Day 29.

transitionRules.name: Dose Interruption for Moderate ALT/AST
transitionRules.text: If ALT/AST > 3x ULN and <= 5x ULN, temporarily interrupt dosing. Rechallenge at 15 mg QOD when ALT/AST is < 2x ULN.

transitionRules.name: Dose Discontinuation for Severe ALT/AST
transitionRules.text: If ALT/AST > 5x ULN, discontinue study intervention.

transitionRules.name: Dose Reduction for Neutropenia
transitionRules.text: If neutrophils decrease >30% from baseline and are below reference range, reduce dose to previous dose level or reduce dose to 15 mg QOD if on 15 mg QD.

transitionRules.name: Dose Interruption for Potential Liver Injury
transitionRules.text: If Bilirubin > 2x ULN with ALT > 3x ULN, temporarily interrupt dosing. Rechallenge at 15 mg QOD or less frequent when bilirubin is below ULN, with Medical Monitor approval.

transitionRules.name: Dose Modification for Neurologic/Psychiatric Worsening
transitionRules.text: Investigator and Alexion Medical Monitor will evaluate the need for dose modification (interruption, increase or decrease) based on neurologic or psychiatric worsening.

transitionRules.name: Discontinuation for Serious Hypersensitivity
transitionRules.text: Participants must be considered for discontinuation from study intervention if a serious hypersensitivity reaction occurs.

transitionRules.name: Discontinuation for Severe Infection
transitionRules.text: Participants must be considered for discontinuation from study intervention if a severe uncontrolled infection occurs.

transitionRules.name: Discontinuation for Disallowed Medication
transitionRules.text: Participants must be considered for discontinuation from study intervention for use of disallowed medication.

transitionRules.name: Discontinuation for Pregnancy
transitionRules.text: Participants must be considered for discontinuation from study intervention for pregnancy or planned pregnancy.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Study Completion
scheduleTimelineExits.description: A participant is considered to have completed the study if he/she has completed all phases of the study including the last scheduled procedure shown in the Schedule of Activities.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Participant Withdrawal of Consent
scheduleTimelineExits.description: A participant may withdraw from the study at any time at his/her own request.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Investigator Discretionary Withdrawal
scheduleTimelineExits.description: A participant may be withdrawn at any time at the discretion of the Investigator for safety, behavioral, compliance, or administrative reasons.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Lost to Follow-up
scheduleTimelineExits.description: A participant will be considered lost to follow-up if he or she repeatedly fails to return for scheduled visits and is unable to be contacted by the study site.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Sponsor Termination of Study
scheduleTimelineExits.description: Alexion reserves the right to close the study site or terminate the study at any time for any reason at the sole discretion of Alexion.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Early Site Closure
scheduleTimelineExits.description: A study site may be closed early for reasons including failure to comply with protocol, inadequate recruitment, or discontinuation of study intervention development.

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: Dose Titration Decision
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: Decision point on Day 29 to titrate dose from 15 mg/day to 30 mg/day, based on safety review of data through Day 23.

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: Ongoing Safety-Based Dose Modification
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: Ongoing decisions to modify, interrupt, or discontinue dosing based on safety monitoring for liver function, hematology, and neurologic/psychiatric status.
